definitions.definition: To demand , to insist upon (having); to call for authoritatively.
Naturally to demand (something) as indispensable ; to need , to call for as necessary.
To demand (of someone) to do something.
examples: It is require d (of me) that I give evidence in court.

definitions.definition: To ask (someone) for something; to request .

main_definition: To demand , to insist upon (having); to call for authoritatively. [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: Naturally to demand (something) as indispensable ; to need , to call for as necessary. [from 15th c.]
To demand (of someone) to do something. [from 18th c.]
( obsolete ) To ask (someone) for something; to request . [14th–17th c.]
